Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops posterior chain power for explosive acceleration, snap shooting from cover, and maintaining low athletic positions during games.
Description: Position yourself inside the trap bar with feet hip-width apart. Grip the handles, engage your core, and hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent. Drive through your heels to lift the bar, extending your hips and knees simultaneously. Explosively jump at the top of the movement, then land softly. Lower the bar back down with control, maintaining a neutral spine throughout.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Improves single-leg stability and strength for lateral movements, stepping over bunkers, and maintaining balance during quick transitions on uneven terrain.
Description: Place one foot on an elevated platform (box or bench). Explosively drive through the elevated leg, switching feet in mid-air to land with the opposite foot on the platform. Focus on powerful leg drive and quick foot transitions. Land softly with control and immediately transition into the next rep.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Conditions your anaerobic system to match paintball's demand pattern: short explosive bursts followed by brief recovery periods. Builds game-ready conditioning.
Description: Execute the plyometric or sprint movement with explosive power and proper mechanics. Focus on powerful leg drive, quick foot contacts, and maintaining an athletic posture. Land softly from all jumps, absorbing impact through your joints. Complete the prescribed repetitions or distance with consistent intensity.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops posterior chain power for explosive acceleration, snap shooting from cover, and maintaining low athletic positions during games.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding kettlebells at your sides. Hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat and a slight bend in your knees. Lower the weights until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping your core engaged. Drive through your heels to return to standingand explosively jump at the top, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Strengthens the back and grip for marker control, pulling yourself up or over obstacles, and maintaining posture during extended games.
Description: Hold a medicine ball or slam ball at chest height. Step in the prescribed pattern while maintaining an athletic stance. Explosively pass the ball forward using your chest and arms, following through toward your target. Catch the ball or retrieve it and reset for the next rep. Combine the stepping pattern with the explosive chest pass movement.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Exercise Name: S/L Plate RDL to Sprinter Step Up
Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee, holding the weight in the opposite hand. Keeping your back flat and maintaining balance, hinge at your hips and lower the weight toward the floor while extending your free leg behind you. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstring, keeping your hips square. Drive through your heel to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top. Complete all reps on one side before switching.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Exercise Name: Pull Apart Hold Lateral Step Over
Paintball Performance Benefit: Improves single-leg stability and strength for lateral movements, stepping over bunkers, and maintaining balance during quick transitions on uneven terrain.
Description: Stand beside an object or hurdle. Step over it laterally with your near leg, then bring your far leg over. Move with control and maintain good posture throughout. Continue moving laterally over the obstacles as prescribed.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Exercise Name: 3 Hurdle Step Over to Lateral Step Over Sprint
Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the weight with an overhand grip in front of your thighs. Keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent, hinge at your hips and lower the weight along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Keep the bar close to your body throughout the entire movement. Engage your core and drive through your heels to reverse the movement and return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Start in an athletic stance. Explosively push off one leg and drive the opposite knee up and forward. Travel as far forward as possible with each bound, landing on the opposite leg. Focus on maximal power generation with each push-off. Maintain an athletic posture and continue bounding for the prescribed distance or reps.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Exercise Name: S/A Front Rack KB Contralateral Lateral Lunge
Paintball Performance Benefit: Improves single-leg stability and strength for lateral movements, stepping over bunkers, and maintaining balance during quick transitions on uneven terrain.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Take a wide step to the side with one leg, keeping your toes pointed forward. Shift your weight onto the stepping leg while keeping the other leg straight. Bend the knee of the stepping leg and push your hips back, keeping your chest up. Push off the stepping leg to return to the starting position. Alternate sides or complete all reps on one side.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops posterior chain power for explosive acceleration, snap shooting from cover, and maintaining low athletic positions during games.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart in a stable position. Hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat and maintaining a slight bend in your knees. Lower the weight until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping the weight close to your body throughout. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to reverse the movement and return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Tips:
• Keep the bar/weight close to your body
• Push through your heels
• Maintain neutral spine throughout

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops posterior chain power for explosive acceleration, snap shooting from cover, and maintaining low athletic positions during games.
Description: Position your upper back against a bench with your feet flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart. Place a barbell across your hips, using a pad for comfort. Engage your core and drive through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. Your body should form a straight line from shoulders to knees at the top position. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat. Keep your chin tucked and gaze forward throughout the movement.
Tips:
• Keep the bar/weight close to your body
• Push through your heels
• Maintain neutral spine throughout

Description: Position yourself appropriately for the core exercise. Engage your core by drawing your belly button toward your spine. Maintain a neutral spine throughout. Focus on controlled movement and proper breathing. Execute with precision, avoiding compensatory movements or excessive momentum.
Tips:
• Avoid holding your breath - breathe naturally
• Focus on preventing movement, not creating it
• Keep hips level and avoid rotation

Sit back and down as if sitting into a chair, pushing your knees out in line with your toes. Descend until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, or as deep as your mobility allows while maintaining good form. Drive through your heels to return to standing, keeping your core tight throughout.

• Maintain proper form over speed

Paintball Performance Benefit: Critical for transferring power between upper and lower body, stabilizing during rapid direction changes, and protecting the spine during dives and impacts.
Description: Start in a high plank position with your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core, squeeze your glutes, and maintain a neutral spine. Keep your hands directly under your shoulders with arms extended. Avoid letting your hips sag or pike up. Breathe steadily and hold for the prescribed time, maintaining maximum tension throughout.
Tips:
• Avoid holding your breath - breathe naturally
• Focus on preventing movement, not creating it
• Keep hips level and avoid rotation

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops posterior chain power for explosive acceleration, snap shooting from cover, and maintaining low athletic positions during games.
Description: Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee, holding the weight in the opposite hand. Keeping your back flat and maintaining balance, hinge at your hips and lower the weight toward the floor while extending your free leg behind you. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstring, keeping your hips square. Drive through your heel to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top. Complete all reps on one side before switching.
Tips:
• Keep the bar/weight close to your body
• Push through your heels
• Maintain neutral spine throughout

Exercise Name: S/L Lateral Hop w/ Reactive Ball
Paintball Performance Benefit: Strengthens the back and grip for marker control, pulling yourself up or over obstacles, and maintaining posture during extended games.
Description: Position yourself appropriately for the pulling movement with a stable base and engaged core. Initiate the pull by retracting your shoulder blades, then drive your elbows back. Focus on squeezing your back muscles at peak contraction. Lower the weight with control, maintaining tension throughout.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Exercise Name: Banded Supine IT Band Stretch to Crossover

Paintball Performance Benefit: Critical for transferring power between upper and lower body, stabilizing during rapid direction changes, and protecting the spine during dives and impacts.
Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes turned out slightly. Keep your chest up, core engaged, and maintain a neutral spine. Sit back and down as if sitting into a chair, pushing your knees out in line with your toes. Descend until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, or as deep as your mobility allows while maintaining good form. Drive through your heels to return to standing, keeping your core tight throughout.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Exercise Name: Jump Lunge to Lateral High Knee Speed Ladder
Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Take a wide step to the side with one leg, keeping your toes pointed forward. Shift your weight onto the stepping leg while keeping the other leg straight. Bend the knee of the stepping leg and push your hips back, keeping your chest up. Push off the stepping leg to return to the starting position. Alternate sides or complete all reps on one side.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent, hinge at your hips and lower the weight along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Keep the bar close to your body throughout the entire movement. Engage your core and drive through your heels to reverse the movement and return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Exercise Name: S/L Toe Touch to Power Skater Hop
Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Balance on one leg with a slight bend in the knee. Explosively jump on the single leg, focusing on height or distance as prescribed. Maintain balance and stability throughout. Land softly on the same leg, absorbing impact through your hip, knee, and ankle. Complete all reps on one side before switching.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Take a wide step to the side with one leg, keeping your toes pointed forward. Push off the stepping leg to return to the starting position. Alternate sides or complete all reps on one side.

• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement

• Maintain proper form over speed

• Focus on quality reps

Move slowly and deliberately, never forcing past your comfortable range. Hold static stretches for the prescribed time or perform dynamic movements for the prescribed repetitions.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Improves single-leg stability and strength for lateral movements, stepping over bunkers, and maintaining balance during quick transitions on uneven terrain.
Description: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Step forward with one leg, landing with your entire foot flat on the ground. Lower your back knee toward the ground by bending both knees, keeping your torso upright and front knee in line with your toes. Descend until both knees are bent to approximately 90 degrees. Drive through your front heel to return to the starting position. Complete all reps on one side before switching.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Conditions your anaerobic system to match paintball's demand pattern: short explosive bursts followed by brief recovery periods. Builds game-ready conditioning.
Description: Execute this conditioning movement with maximal effort and proper form. Focus on generating power from your hips and core. Maintain good breathing patterns and work-to-rest ratios as prescribed. Keep movements explosive yet controlled. Complete the prescribed reps or time interval while maintaining intensity.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Set up in front of the agility ladder. Execute the prescribed footwork pattern through the ladder, focusing on quick, light foot contacts. Keep your center of gravity low and maintain an athletic posture. Move through the ladder as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form and rhythm.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Start in an athletic stance. Explosively push off one leg and drive the opposite knee up and forward. Travel as far forward as possible with each bound, landing on the opposite leg. Focus on maximal power generation with each push-off. Maintain an athletic posture and continue bounding for the prescribed distance or reps.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Builds leg strength and power for running, diving, and maintaining a low athletic stance. Essential for quick direction changes and absorbing impact.
Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes turned out slightly. Keep your chest up, core engaged, and maintain a neutral spine. Sit back and down as if sitting into a chair, pushing your knees out in line with your toes. Descend until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, or as deep as your mobility allows while maintaining good form. Drive through your heels to return to standing, keeping your core tight throughout.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Exercise Name: Double Pogo Hop to Broad Jump
Paintball Performance Benefit: Conditions your anaerobic system to match paintball's demand pattern: short explosive bursts followed by brief recovery periods. Builds game-ready conditioning.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Lower into a quarter squat, swinging your arms back. Explosively jump forward, driving your arms forward and upward. Focus on maximal horizontal distance. Land softly with both feet, absorbing impact through your hips and knees. Reset to starting position or continue as prescribed.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Critical for transferring power between upper and lower body, stabilizing during rapid direction changes, and protecting the spine during dives and impacts.
Description: Start in a high plank position with your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core, squeeze your glutes, and maintain a neutral spine. Keep your hands directly under your shoulders with arms extended. Avoid letting your hips sag or pike up. Breathe steadily and hold for the prescribed time, maintaining maximum tension throughout.
Tips:
• Avoid holding your breath - breathe naturally
• Focus on preventing movement, not creating it
• Keep hips level and avoid rotation

Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Assume an athletic starting position. Explode forward with maximum effort, driving your knees up and pumping your arms powerfully. Focus on proper sprint mechanics: forward lean, powerful leg drive, and quick foot turnover. Maintain this maximal effort for the prescribed distance or time.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Execute the plyometric or sprint movement with explosive power and proper mechanics. Focus on powerful leg drive, quick foot contacts, and maintaining an athletic posture. Land softly from all jumps, absorbing impact through your joints. Complete the prescribed repetitions or distance with consistent intensity.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops posterior chain power for explosive acceleration, snap shooting from cover, and maintaining low athletic positions during games.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart in a stable position. Hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat and maintaining a slight bend in your knees. Lower the weight until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping the weight close to your body throughout. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to reverse the movement and return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Tips:
• Keep the bar/weight close to your body
• Push through your heels
• Maintain neutral spine throughout

Execute the movement with control and proper form, focusing on the target muscle groups. Breathe steadily, exhaling during the exertion phase. Move through the full range of motion while maintaining tension in the working muscles. Complete the prescribed sets and repetitions with consistent quality.

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength for crawling, diving, and stabilizing your marker during rapid fire. Improves endurance for holding shooting positions.
Description: Start in a plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core and glutes to maintain a rigid torso. Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping them at approximately 45 degrees from your body. Descend until your chest nearly touches the ground. Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.

Paintball Performance Benefit: Conditions your anaerobic system to match paintball's demand pattern: short explosive bursts followed by brief recovery periods. Builds game-ready conditioning.

Push off the stepping leg to return to the starting position. Alternate sides or complete all reps on one side.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Description: Position your upper back against a bench with feet flat on the floor. Place a barbell across your hips, using a pad for comfort. Lift one leg off the ground. Drive through the heel of your planted foot to lift your hips toward the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. Your body should form a straight line from shoulders to knees. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat. Complete all reps on one side before switching.
Tips:
• Keep the bar/weight close to your body
• Push through your heels
• Maintain neutral spine throughout

Exercise Name: Lateral Bear Crawl to Sit Through
Paintball Performance Benefit: Strengthens the back and grip for marker control, pulling yourself up or over obstacles, and maintaining posture during extended games.
Description: Position yourself appropriately for the pulling movement with a stable base and engaged core. Initiate the pull by retracting your shoulder blades, then drive your elbows back. Focus on squeezing your back muscles at peak contraction. Lower the weight with control, maintaining tension throughout.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Critical for transferring power between upper and lower body, stabilizing during rapid direction changes, and protecting the spine during dives and impacts.
Description: Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine. Simultaneously extend one arm straight forward and the opposite leg straight back, creating a straight line from fingertips to toes. Hold briefly, focusing on balance and stability. Return with control and repeat with opposite limbs.
Tips:
• Avoid holding your breath - breathe naturally
• Focus on preventing movement, not creating it
• Keep hips level and avoid rotation

Paintball Performance Benefit: Strengthens the back and grip for marker control, pulling yourself up or over obstacles, and maintaining posture during extended games.
Description: Position yourself appropriately for the pulling movement with a stable base and engaged core. Initiate the pull by retracting your shoulder blades, then drive your elbows back. Focus on squeezing your back muscles at peak contraction. Lower the weight with control, maintaining tension throughout.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Start in an athletic stance. Explosively push off one leg and drive the opposite knee up and forward. Travel as far forward as possible with each bound, landing on the opposite leg. Focus on maximal power generation with each push-off. Maintain an athletic posture and continue bounding for the prescribed distance or reps.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Exercise Name: Iso Split Squat/Jump Lunge/Sprinter High Knee
Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Assume a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back, maintaining balance. Keep your torso upright and core engaged. Lower your back knee toward the ground by bending both knees, keeping your front knee in line with your toes. Descend until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Drive through your front heel to return to the starting position. Complete all reps on one side before switching.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Exercise Name: Low Hang Lateral Lunge w/ Pause
Paintball Performance Benefit: Improves single-leg stability and strength for lateral movements, stepping over bunkers, and maintaining balance during quick transitions on uneven terrain.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Take a wide step to the side with one leg, keeping your toes pointed forward. Shift your weight onto the stepping leg while keeping the other leg straight. Bend the knee of the stepping leg and push your hips back, keeping your chest up. Push off the stepping leg to return to the starting position. Alternate sides or complete all reps on one side.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Builds leg strength and power for running, diving, and maintaining a low athletic stance. Essential for quick direction changes and absorbing impact.
Description: Assume a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back, maintaining balance. Keep your torso upright and core engaged. Lower your back knee toward the ground by bending both knees, keeping your front knee in line with your toes. Descend until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Drive through your front heel to return to the starting position. Complete all reps on one side before switching.

• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength for crawling, diving, and stabilizing your marker during rapid fire. Improves endurance for holding shooting positions.
Description: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back in a natural arch. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width. Unrack the bar and position it over your chest with arms extended. Lower the bar under control to your mid-chest, keeping your elbows at approximately 45 degrees from your body. Press the bar back up explosively until your arms are fully extended. Maintain core tension and keep your shoulder blades retracted throughout.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength for crawling, diving, and stabilizing your marker during rapid fire. Improves endurance for holding shooting positions.

Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.

Paintball Performance Benefit: Builds leg strength and power for running, diving, and maintaining a low athletic stance. Essential for quick direction changes and absorbing impact.
Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes turned out slightly. Keep your chest up, core engaged, and maintain a neutral spine. Sit back and down as if sitting into a chair, pushing your knees out in line with your toes. Drive through your heels to return to standing, keeping your core tight throughout.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Description: Position yourself appropriately for the core exercise. Engage your core by drawing your belly button toward your spine. Maintain a neutral spine throughout. Focus on controlled movement and proper breathing. Execute with precision, avoiding compensatory movements or excessive momentum.
Tips:
• Avoid holding your breath - breathe naturally
• Focus on preventing movement, not creating it
• Keep hips level and avoid rotation

Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart in a stable position. Hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat and maintaining a slight bend in your knees. • Push through your heels
• Maintain neutral spine throughout

Execute the movement with control and proper form, focusing on the target muscle groups. Breathe steadily, exhaling during the exertion phase. Move through the full range of motion while maintaining tension in the working muscles. Complete the prescribed sets and repetitions with consistent quality.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Builds leg strength and power for running, diving, and maintaining a low athletic stance. Essential for quick direction changes and absorbing impact.
Description: Hold a kettlebell or dumbbell vertically at chest height, with both hands cupping the weight. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, toes turned out slightly. Keeping your chest up and core engaged, sit back and down, pushing your knees out in line with your toes. Descend until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, keeping the weight close to your body. Drive through your heels to return to standing, maintaining an upright torso throughout.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops posterior chain power for explosive acceleration, snap shooting from cover, and maintaining low athletic positions during games.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart in a stable position. Hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat and maintaining a slight bend in your knees. Lower the weight until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping the weight close to your body throughout. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to reverse the movement and return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Tips:
• Keep the bar/weight close to your body
• Push through your heels
• Maintain neutral spine throughout

Paintball Performance Benefit: Strengthens the back and grip for marker control, pulling yourself up or over obstacles, and maintaining posture during extended games.
Description: Position yourself appropriately for the pulling movement with a stable base and engaged core. Initiate the pull by retracting your shoulder blades, then drive your elbows back. Focus on squeezing your back muscles at peak contraction. Lower the weight with control, maintaining tension throughout.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Conditions your anaerobic system to match paintball's demand pattern: short explosive bursts followed by brief recovery periods. Builds game-ready conditioning.
Description: Start with the weight at the starting position. Explosively pull the weight up by extending your hips, knees, and ankles simultaneously. As the weight reaches chest height, quickly drop under it by bending your knees and catch it in a front rack position, receiving in a partial squat. Stand up fully to complete the rep. Return to starting position and repeat.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength for crawling, diving, and stabilizing your marker during rapid fire. Improves endurance for holding shooting positions.
Description: Position yourself appropriately for the pressing movement. Engage your core and maintain proper alignment throughout. Lower the weight under control, maintaining tension in the target muscles. Press the weight explosively to the starting position, focusing on proper mechanics and full range of motion.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength for crawling, diving, and stabilizing your marker during rapid fire. Improves endurance for holding shooting positions.
Description: Start in a plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core and glutes to maintain a rigid torso. Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping them at approximately 45 degrees from your body. Descend until your chest nearly touches the ground. Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Paintball Performance Benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength for crawling, diving, and stabilizing your marker during rapid fire. Improves endurance for holding shooting positions.

Paintball Performance Benefit: Conditions your anaerobic system to match paintball's demand pattern: short explosive bursts followed by brief recovery periods. Builds game-ready conditioning.
Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Quickly drop into a quarter squat while swinging your arms back. Explosively jump straight up, driving your arms overhead for maximum height. Land softly with both feet, absorbing impact through your hips and knees. Reset and repeat.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Builds leg strength and power for running, diving, and maintaining a low athletic stance. Essential for quick direction changes and absorbing impact.
Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes turned out slightly. Keep your chest up, core engaged, and maintain a neutral spine. Sit back and down as if sitting into a chair, pushing your knees out in line with your toes. Descend until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, or as deep as your mobility allows while maintaining good form. Drive through your heels to return to standing, keeping your core tight throughout.
Tips:
• Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
• Focus on explosive takeoff and controlled landing
• Keep core engaged throughout the movement

Paintball Performance Benefit: Critical for transferring power between upper and lower body, stabilizing during rapid direction changes, and protecting the spine during dives and impacts.
Description: Start in a high plank position with your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core, squeeze your glutes, and maintain a neutral spine. Keep your hands directly under your shoulders with arms extended. Avoid letting your hips sag or pike up. Breathe steadily and hold for the prescribed time, maintaining maximum tension throughout.
Tips:
• Avoid holding your breath - breathe naturally
• Focus on preventing movement, not creating it
• Keep hips level and avoid rotation

Paintball Performance Benefit: Conditions your anaerobic system to match paintball's demand pattern: short explosive bursts followed by brief recovery periods. Builds game-ready conditioning.
Description: Hold the weight in a front rack position at shoulder height. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Perform a front squat by descending until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Explosively drive up through your heels. As you reach standing, continue the momentum to press the weight overhead in one fluid motion. Lower to front rack position and immediately descend into the next squat.
Tips:
• Maintain proper form over speed
• Breathe consistently throughout the movement
• Focus on quality reps

Exercise Name: Sprinters Step Up X High Knee
Paintball Performance Benefit: Directly trains the explosive speed, agility, and change of direction skills needed for breaking to bunkers, evading opponents, and creating angles.
Description: Place one foot on an elevated platform (box or bench). Drive through the elevated heel to step up explosively while simultaneously driving the opposite knee up high toward your chest in a sprinter position. Control your descent and repeat. Complete all reps on one side before switching.
Tips:
• Maintain proper sprint mechanics: drive knees up
• Quick foot contacts with the ground
• Stay light on your feet and athletic

Description: Start in a high plank position with your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core, squeeze your glutes, and maintain a neutral spine. Keep your hands directly under your shoulders with arms extended. Avoid letting your hips sag or pike up. Breathe steadily and hold for the prescribed time, maintaining maximum tension throughout.

• Keep hips level and avoid rotation
